b0:root.name: Root - Boundary Anchor
b0:root.description: Unique boundary vertex serving as the foundational anchor for the entire assurance complex

v:doc:architecture-incose-paper.name: Architecture Document - INCOSE Paper Assurance Framework
v:doc:architecture-incose-paper.description: 4-layer SE architecture for the document assurance framework demonstrated in the INCOSE IS 2026 paper
v:doc:architecture-incose-paper.scope: A framework for verifying, validating, and assuring LLM-assisted documents using typed simplicial complexes with human accountability

v:doc:incose-paper-2026.name: INCOSE IS 2026 Paper - Test-Driven Document Development
v:doc:incose-paper-2026.description: Draft research paper demonstrating simplicial complex framework for verification, validation, and assurance

v:doc:lifecycle-incose-paper.name: Engineering Lifecycle for INCOSE Paper Development
v:doc:lifecycle-incose-paper.description: Documents the systematic process for developing assured research papers within the typed simplicial complex framework

v:doc:literature-review-incose-paper.name: Literature Review - INCOSE IS 2026 Paper on Document Assurance Framework
v:doc:literature-review-incose-paper.description: Comprehensive literature review supporting the INCOSE paper on test-driven document development using typed simplicial complexes
v:doc:literature-review-incose-paper.topic: Document Verification, Validation, Assurance, and Accountability
v:doc:literature-review-incose-paper.search_strategy: Targeted search of IEEE standards, INCOSE publications, topology textbooks, and AI ethics frameworks

v:doc:novel-contributions-incose-paper.name: Novel Research Contributions - INCOSE IS 2026 Paper
v:doc:novel-contributions-incose-paper.description: Enumeration and ranking of intellectual contributions from the assurance framework research for the INCOSE IS 2026 submission

v:guidance:learning-module.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent learning module documents defining effective, well-structured learning units

v:guidance:organization.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent organization chart documents

v:guidance:property.name: Guidance for Property Documents
v:guidance:property.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent property documents defining abstract attributes that can be possessed by vertices

v:guidance:protocol.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent protocol documents defining systematic workflows, phases, collaboration, quality checks, and principles

v:guidance:purpose.name: Guidance for Purpose Documents
v:guidance:purpose.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent purpose documents defining problems solved, objectives, deliverables, constraints, and success criteria

v:guidance:skill.name: Guidance for Skill Documents
v:guidance:skill.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent skill documents defining learnable capabilities possessed by actors and required by learning modules

v:guidance:spec.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent specification documents

v:guidance:syllabus.description: Best practices and workflow for designing and validating syllabus chart documents representing learning journeys

v:guidance:system_prompt.name: Guidance for System Prompt Documents
v:guidance:system_prompt.description: Quality criteria and best practices for creating excellent system prompt documents that integrate Persona, Purpose, and Protocol using the PPP framework

v:spec:actor.name: Specification for Actor Documents
v:spec:actor.description: Defines what makes a valid actor document - entities that can perform actions, possess properties, and participate in relationships

v:spec:architecture.name: Specification for Architecture Documents
v:spec:architecture.description: Defines what makes a valid architecture document using the 4-layer SE framework (Conceptual, Functional, Logical, Physical)

v:spec:assurance_audit.name: Specification for Assurance Audit Documents
v:spec:assurance_audit.description: Defines what makes a valid assurance audit chart in the knowledge complex

v:spec:assured_signed_chart.name: Specification for Assured Signed Chart Documents
v:spec:assured_signed_chart.description: Defines what makes a valid assured-signed chart - complete assurance with explicit signature accountability

v:spec:chart.name: Specification for Chart Documents
v:spec:chart.description: Defines what makes a valid chart document in the knowledge complex

v:spec:guidance.name: Specification for Guidance Documents
v:spec:guidance.description: Defines what makes a valid guidance document in the knowledge complex

v:spec:incose-literature-review.name: Specification for INCOSE Literature Review Documents
v:spec:incose-literature-review.description: Defines structural requirements for literature review documents supporting INCOSE paper submissions

v:spec:incose-paper.name: Specification for INCOSE IS 2026 Research Paper
v:spec:incose-paper.description: Comprehensive structural requirements for an INCOSE International Symposium 2026 research paper submission, derived from official Call for Submissions and INCOSE publication standards

v:spec:incose-self-demonstration.name: Specification for INCOSE Self-Demonstrating Paper
v:spec:incose-self-demonstration.description: Extended specification for INCOSE papers that demonstrate their framework by being instances of it, requiring consistency with architecture, lifecycle, literature review, and novel contributions documents

v:spec:inherits.name: Specification for Inherits Edges
v:spec:inherits.description: Defines structure and semantics for inherits edges that track type inheritance relationships

v:spec:learning-module.name: Specification for Learning Module Documents
v:spec:learning-module.description: Structural requirements for learning module documents defining individual learning units with objectives, prerequisites, and assessments

v:spec:lifecycle.name: Specification for Lifecycle Documents
v:spec:lifecycle.description: Defines structural requirements for engineering lifecycle process documents describing assured document development workflows

v:spec:novel-contributions.name: Specification for Novel Contributions Documents
v:spec:novel-contributions.description: Defines what makes a valid novel contributions document that enumerates and ranks research contributions

v:spec:organization.name: Specification for Organization Charts
v:spec:organization.description: Defines the structure and constraints for organization chart type documents representing teams, roles, resources, and their relationships

v:spec:persona.name: Specification for Persona Documents
v:spec:persona.description: Defines what makes a valid persona document - the identity, expertise, approach, tone, and boundaries of an AI model

v:spec:property.name: Specification for Property Documents
v:spec:property.description: Defines what makes a valid property document - attributes, characteristics, or capabilities that can be possessed by actors

v:spec:protocol.name: Specification for Protocol Documents
v:spec:protocol.description: Defines what makes a valid protocol document - the systematic workflow, phases, user collaboration, quality checks, and consistent principles

v:spec:purpose.name: Specification for Purpose Documents
v:spec:purpose.description: Defines what makes a valid purpose document - the problem statement, objectives, deliverables, constraints, and success criteria

v:spec:qualifies.name: Specification for Qualifies Edge Documents
v:spec:qualifies.description: Defines what makes a valid qualifies edge - credential linking signer to guidance they can validate against

v:spec:signature.name: Specification for Signature Face Documents
v:spec:signature.description: Defines what makes a valid signature face - accountability triangle coupling doc, guidance, and signer with shared validation edge

v:spec:signer.name: Specification for Signer Documents
v:spec:signer.description: Defines what makes a valid signer document - actors with verified GitHub identity who can sign validation edges

v:spec:signs.name: Specification for Signs Edge Documents
v:spec:signs.description: Defines what makes a valid signs edge - attestation event where signer attests to a document

v:spec:skill.name: Specification for Skill Documents
v:spec:skill.description: Defines what makes a valid skill document - learnable capabilities or knowledge that can be possessed by students and required by learning modules

v:spec:spec.name: Specification for Specifications
v:spec:spec.description: Defines what makes a valid specification document in the knowledge complex

v:spec:student.name: Specification for Student Documents
v:spec:student.description: Defines what makes a valid student document - actors engaged in learning who possess skills and study learning modules

v:spec:syllabus.name: Specification for Syllabus Charts
v:spec:syllabus.description: Defines the structure and constraints for syllabus chart type documents representing learning journeys with prerequisite validation and skill accumulation

v:spec:system_prompt.name: Specification for System Prompt Documents
v:spec:system_prompt.description: Defines what makes a valid system prompt document composed of typed subsections (persona, purpose, protocol) following the PPP framework

c:test-tetrahedron.scope: 4 test vertices forming K4 complete graph, with 3 of 4 possible faces (missing beta-gamma-delta)
